message.content:
{"id": "17993", 
"title": "Bug 17993: Find/Replace shouldn't replace typed entry with value from history", 
"description": "It would be better if what I type isn't replaced with a value from the history. The current behavior is similar to autocomplete which is common in browsers. In the future, a full autocomplete feature could be provided.", 
"OB": "When using the F1 build and accessing the Find/Replace dialog through Edit -> Find/Replace..., the history of recent searches is available. However, when typing in the 'Find' or 'Replace With' fields, if a previous search entry is found, it replaces what has been typed with the value from the history. The search of the history is case-insensitive, resulting in a change in the case of the typed entry to match the value from history. This behavior can prevent certain find or replace operations from being performed.", 
"EB": "For me, it is very common to perform find and replace operations like this. I believe the current behavior should be changed to something simpler that allows a full range of find and replace operations to be performed while still respecting the case of what the user types. Until then, I suggest removing this feature. To reproduce the issue, open a document so that Edit -> Find/Replace... becomes available. However, you shouldn't be able to perform the find or replace operations as the typed entry will be replaced with a value from the history. The same behavior applies to the 'Replace With' field.", 
"SR": "Modify the behavior of the Find/Replace dialog to not replace the typed entry with a value from the history. Allow a full range of find and replace operations to be performed while respecting the case of what the user types."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '17993', 'title': "Bug 17993Find/Replace shouldn't replace typed entry with value from history", 'description': 'It wouldbe better if what I type isn\'t replaced with a value from the history.The current behaviour seems to be similar to "autocomplete" which isparticularly common in browsers. In the future, perhaps, a full "autocomplete"feature could be provided. ', 'OB': 'I\'m using the F1 build.The Find/Replace dialog (accessed through EditFind/Replace...) has a historyof recent searches. When you type in the "Find" or "Replace With" fields itsearches for entries from a previous search. If it finds one, it replaces whatyou have typed with the value from the history. The search of the history iscase insensitive, which means that the case of what you have typed may bechanged to the case of the value in the history.In some scenarios this makes it impossible to perform find or replaceoperations. ', 'EB': "Bug 17993Find/Replace shouldn't replace typed entry with value from history For me, it isvery common to perform operations like this.I think the current behaviour to be changed to something more simple whichallows the full range of find and replace operations to be performed. But this should still respect the case of what theuser types. Until then, I think the feature should be removed.To reproduce: Open a document so that EditFind/Replace... becomes available. You shouldn't be able to.The behaviour is similar for the Replace With field. ", 'SR': ''}
